name: Instagram Live
primary_goal_vibe: Real-time connection, Q&A, launches, and deepening trust through unedited interaction.
tone_preference: Human, direct, and responsive. Less polished than feed content but still on-brand and intentional.

copy_guidelines.copy_best_practices: Title and description should clearly state the topic, who it is for, and what viewers will gain. Keep the description concise and outcome-focused. During the Live, repeat the key value proposition and CTA regularly for people who join late.
copy_guidelines.caption_structure_hint: Title: clear and specific topic. Description: 2–3 short lines covering what, who, and why now. Include 1 main CTA (follow, visit profile, tap link).
copy_guidelines.recommended_caption_length: Short. The focus is on spoken content; text only frames expectations.
cta_examples: Send your questions in the chat
Tap the link in bio for details
Share this Live with someone who needs it

on_screen_text_guidelines.primary_role: Support context for joiners and highlight key moments.
best_practices: Use pinned comments to restate topic and CTA
Use occasional on-screen text overlays for key points if using external tools
Keep any text short and immediately understandable

hashtags_mentions.recommended_hashtags: Use a small set of relevant hashtags in the Live announcement posts or Stories, not inside the Live itself.
hashtags_mentions.hashtag_strategy: Focus on topic and series consistency. Do not overuse broad, generic tags.
hashtags_mentions.mention_strategy: Tag co-hosts, guests, or brands in the announcement and recap posts to amplify reach.

technical_constraints.recommended_duration: 15–60 minutes depending on topic depth and audience retention.
technical_constraints.connection_note: Stable connection is critical; test audio and video before going Live.
technical_constraints.safe_area_note: Keep faces and any props in the central area to avoid being obscured by interface elements and comments.

required_elements: Single main CTA repeated throughout the session
Active interaction with chat (questions, shout-outs, answers)
Opening hook explaining what viewers will get from staying
disallowed_practices: Starting the Live without explaining the topic
Clickbait titles that are not aligned with the actual content
